headline: Former Northrop Grumman CEO Ronald Sugar And Ex-CIA Venture Chief Gilman Louie Join Ursa Major Board To Scale Hypersonic Defense Tech
summary: Ursa Major is ramping up production of hypersonic engines, solid rocket motors, and space-based defense systems for the U.S. military and allied forces. Now the Colorado propulsion manufacturer has recruited two influential figures in aerospace and national security to help accelerate that mission. The company announced on Oct. 2 the appointment of Dr. Ronald Sugar and Gilman Louie to its board. headline: RTX to Supply Its SPY-6(V)1 Radar for Germany's F127 Frigates
summary: RTX secures a deal to equip Germany's F127 frigates with its advanced SPY-6(V)1 radar, expanding its global defense footprint.

raw.headline: RTX to Supply Its SPY-6(V)1 Radar for Germany's F127 Frigates

headline: Northrop Grumman (NOC) Is Up 5.4% After Successful Autonomous Docking Milestone – Has the Bull Case Changed?
summary: Northrop Grumman recently announced it had successfully completed autonomous rendezvous, docking, and proximity operations with Starlab Space Stations and Voyager Technologies, marking a milestone for its Cygnus spacecraft. This achievement advances Northrop Grumman's autonomous spaceflight capabilities, which could expand its role in commercial cargo delivery to low Earth orbit space stations. Next, we’ll explore how this breakthrough in autonomous space operations could impact Northrop...
